name: Donald S. Smith
title: Of Counsel
biography:
Donald Smith limits his practice to representing employers and executives in labor and employment matters. He defends employers in cases pending before state and federal courts, the National Labor Relations Board, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, Indiana Civil Rights Commission, U.S. Department of Labor, OSHA, IOSHA, Indiana Department of Workforce Development, and Indiana Worker's Compensation Board.

Don advises employers concerning various employment issues such as employee handbooks, employment agreements, severance agreements, covenants not to compete, restrictive covenants, wrongful termination, collective bargaining, labor arbitration, unions, discrimination, harassment, wage and hour matters, unemployment compensation, and worker's compensation.
representativeMatters: Prosecuted and defended numerous requests for temporary and permanent injunctions in non-compete cases on behalf of employers.

Defended an insurance company in employment discrimination case that set the standard for determining whether an insurance agent is an independent contractor: Knight v. United Farm Bureau Mut. Ins. Co., Inc., 950 F.2d 377 (7th Cir. 1991).
Defended county employer at trial and on appeal against wrongful discharge claim: Moulton v. Vigo Co., 150 F.3d 801 (7th Cir. 1998).
Represented employer in a religious discrimination case: Anderson v. U.S.F. Logistics, 274 F.3d. 470 (7th Cir. 2001).
Represented employer in a wage case: Damon Corp. v. Estes, 750 N.E.2d 891 (Ind. Ct. App. 2001).
Represented employer hospital in a worker's compensation case: Christopher R. Brown, DDS, Inc. v. Decatur Co. Memorial Hospital, Inc., 892 N.E.2d 642 (Ind. 2008).
Defended employer in a class action wage and hour case: Artis v. First Revenue Assurance, LLC, (1:09-cv-01555, S. D. Ind. 2009).

beyondOffice: Don and his wife, Debbie, are the proud parents of three sons, and the very proud grandparents of six grandchildren. All three of their sons are medical doctors after attending medical school at Indiana University. Don remains a huge sports fanatic, with special interests in his Indianapolis Colts, Indiana Pacers, Indianapolis Indians, and Chicago Cubs (with whom he has played in two fantasy camps). During the college football season, Don particularly roots for DePauw, Miami (Fla.), and Alabama, teams he 'adopted' as a result of where his sons attended school. Don is an avid golfer who is constantly in search of the 'perfect swing.'
